content_old: 3 And the king turned about his face, and blessed all the convocation of Israel,—while all the convocation of Israel was standing;

content_old: 6 nevertheless I have made choice of Jerusalem, that my Name might be there,—and I have made choice of David, that he might be over my people Israel.

content: 7 And so it came to pass､ that it was near the heart of David my father,—to build a house, to the Name of Yahweh､ God of Israel.
content_old: 7 And so it came to pass､ that it was near the heart of David my father,—to build a house, to the Name of Yahweh､ God of Israel.

content: 8 Then said Yahweh unto David my father, Because it was near thy heart to build a house for my Name thou didst well that it was near thy heart:
content_old: 8 Then said Yahweh unto David my father, Because it was near thy heart to build a house for my Name thou didst well that it was near thy heart:

content: 9 Only thou thyself must not build the house,—but thine own son､ that proceedeth out of thy loins—he shall build the house for my Name.
content_old: 9 Only thou thyself must not build the house,—but thine own son､ that proceedeth out of thy loins—he shall build the house for my Name.

content: 10 So then Yahweh hath established his word､ which he spake,—and I have been raised up instead of David my father､ and have taken my seat upon the throne of Israel､ as spake Yahweh､ and have built the house to the Name of Yahweh､ God of Israel;
content_old: 10 So then Yahweh hath established his word､ which he spake,—and I have been raised up instead of David my father､ and have taken my seat upon the throne of Israel､ as spake Yahweh､ and have built the house to the Name of Yahweh､ God of Israel;

content: 11 and have put there､ the ark,—wherein is the covenant of Yahweh,—which he solemnised with the sons of Israel.
content_old: 11 and have put there､ the ark,—wherein is the covenant of Yahweh,—which he solemnised with the sons of Israel.

content: 12 Then stood he before the altar of Yahweh, in the presence of all the convocation of Israel,—and spread forth his hands;
content_old: 12 Then stood he before the altar of Yahweh, in the presence of all the convocation of Israel,—and spread forth his hands;

content: 13 for Solomon had made a platform of bronze､ and had set it in the midst of the enclosure, five cubits the length thereof､ and five cubits the breadth thereof, and three cubits the height thereof,—and he stood thereon, and knelt upon his knees､ in the presence of all the convocation of Israel, and spread forth his hands､ heavenward;
content_old: 13 for Solomon had made a platform of bronze､ and had set it in the midst of the enclosure, five cubits the length thereof､ and five cubits the breadth thereof, and three cubits the height thereof,—and he stood thereon, and knelt upon his knees､ in the presence of all the convocation of Israel, and spread forth his hands､ heavenward;

content: 14 and said､ O Yahweh! God of Israel､ Not like unto thee is there a god, in the heavens､ or throughout the earth,—who keepest Covenant and Lovingkindness for thy servants who are walking before thee with all their heart:
content_old: 14 and said､ O Yahweh! God of Israel､ Not like unto thee is there a god, in the heavens､ or throughout the earth,—who keepest Covenant and Lovingkindness for thy servants who are walking before thee with all their heart:

content: 15 who hast kept､ for thy servant David my father, that which thou didst promise him,—in that thou didst promise with thy mouth､ and with thy hand hast fulfilled､ as it is this day.
content_old: 15 who hast kept､ for thy servant David my father, that which thou didst promise him,—in that thou didst promise with thy mouth､ and with thy hand hast fulfilled､ as it is this day.

content: 16 Now therefore､ O Yahweh—God of Israel､ keep thou､ for thy servant David my father that which thou didst promise him､ saying, There shall not be cut off to thee a man､ from before me, to sit upon the throne of Israel,—if only thy sons take heed to their way､ to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me.
content_old: 16 Now therefore､ O Yahweh—God of Israel､ keep thou､ for thy servant David my father that which thou didst promise him､ saying, There shall not be cut off to thee a man､ from before me, to sit upon the throne of Israel,—if only thy sons take heed to their way､ to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me.

content: 17 Now therefore､ O Yahweh､ God of Israel,—verified be thy promise, which thou didst make unto thy servant David.
content_old: 17 Now therefore､ O Yahweh､ God of Israel,—verified be thy promise, which thou didst make unto thy servant David.

content: 18 But in very deed will God dwell with man on the earth? Lo! the heavens､ even the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee, how much less this house which I have built!
content_old: 18 But in very deed will God dwell with man on the earth? Lo! the heavens､ even the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee, how much less this house which I have built!

content: 19 Wilt thou then turn unto the prayer of thy servant and unto his supplication､ O Yahweh my God,—to hearken unto the cry and unto the prayer, wherewith thy servant is praying before thee:
content_old: 19 Wilt thou then turn unto the prayer of thy servant and unto his supplication､ O Yahweh my God,—to hearken unto the cry and unto the prayer, wherewith thy servant is praying before thee:

content: 20 that thine eyes may be open toward this house､ day and night, toward the place of which thou hast said thou wouldst set thy Name there,—to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant may pray towards this place:
content_old: 20 that thine eyes may be open toward this house､ day and night, toward the place of which thou hast said thou wouldst set thy Name there,—to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant may pray towards this place:

content: 21 wilt thou therefore hearken unto the supplications of thy servant､ and thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place,—yea wilt thou thyself hear､ out of thine own dwelling-place､ out of the heavens, and when thou hearest then wilt thou forgive?
content_old: 21 wilt thou therefore hearken unto the supplications of thy servant､ and thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place,—yea wilt thou thyself hear､ out of thine own dwelling-place､ out of the heavens, and when thou hearest then wilt thou forgive?

content: 22 If a man shall sin against his neighbour, and there shall be laid upon him an oath､ to put him on oath,—and an oath shall come before thine altar in this house
content_old: 22 If a man shall sin against his neighbour, and there shall be laid upon him an oath､ to put him on oath,—and an oath shall come before thine altar in this house

content: 23 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens､ and act, and judge thy servants, bringing back unto the lawless, to set his way upon his own head,—and justifying the righteous, by giving to him､ according to his righteousness?
content_old: 23 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens､ and act, and judge thy servants, bringing back unto the lawless, to set his way upon his own head,—and justifying the righteous, by giving to him､ according to his righteousness?

content: 24 Or if thy people Israel be smitten before an enemy､ because they have been sinning against thee,—and they turn､ and confess thy Name, and pray and make supplication before thee､ in this house
content_old: 24 Or if thy people Israel be smitten before an enemy､ because they have been sinning against thee,—and they turn､ and confess thy Name, and pray and make supplication before thee､ in this house

content: 25 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel,—and bring them back unto the soil, which thou didst give to them and to their fathers?
content_old: 25 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel,—and bring them back unto the soil, which thou didst give to them and to their fathers?

content: 26 When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain､ because they have been sinning against thee,—and they shall pray towards this place､ and shall confess thy Name, from their sin shall return､ because thou hast been afflicting them
content_old: 26 When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain､ because they have been sinning against thee,—and they shall pray towards this place､ and shall confess thy Name, from their sin shall return､ because thou hast been afflicting them

content: 27 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens and forgive the sin of thy servants､ and thy people Israel, that thou mayest direct them into the good way､ wherein they should walk,—and give rain､ upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people､ for an inheritance?
content_old: 27 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens and forgive the sin of thy servants､ and thy people Israel, that thou mayest direct them into the good way､ wherein they should walk,—and give rain､ upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people､ for an inheritance?

content: 28 When there shall be a famine in the land, when there shall be a pestilence—when there shall be blasting or mildew､ locust or caterpillar—when their enemy shall besiege them in the land at their own gates—whatsoever plague or whatsoever sickness;—
content_old: 28 When there shall be a famine in the land, when there shall be a pestilence—when there shall be blasting or mildew､ locust or caterpillar—when their enemy shall besiege them in the land at their own gates—whatsoever plague or whatsoever sickness;—

content: 29 whatsoever prayer､ whatsoever supplication､ which any son of earth may have, or any of thy people Israel,—when any man shall come to know his plague､ or his pain, and so he shall spread abroad his hands towards this house—
content_old: 29 whatsoever prayer､ whatsoever supplication､ which any son of earth may have, or any of thy people Israel,—when any man shall come to know his plague､ or his pain, and so he shall spread abroad his hands towards this house—

content: 30 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens､ the settled place of thine abode､ and forgive, and grant to every man according to his ways, whose heart thou wilt know,—for thou thyself alone knowest the heart of the sons of men:
content_old: 30 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens､ the settled place of thine abode､ and forgive, and grant to every man according to his ways, whose heart thou wilt know,—for thou thyself alone knowest the heart of the sons of men:

content: 31 to the end they may revere thee�� to walk in thy ways, all the days which they shall be living upon the face of the soil,—which thou gavest unto their fathers?
content_old: 31 to the end they may revere thee�� to walk in thy ways, all the days which they shall be living upon the face of the soil,—which thou gavest unto their fathers?

content: 32 Moreover also unto the stranger who is not of thy people Israel､ but he shall come in out of a far country—for the sake of thy great Name､ and of thy strong hand, and of thine outstretched arm,—and so they shall come in and pray towards this house
content_old: 32 Moreover also unto the stranger who is not of thy people Israel､ but he shall come in out of a far country—for the sake of thy great Name､ and of thy strong hand, and of thine outstretched arm,—and so they shall come in and pray towards this house

content: 33 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens､ out of the settled place of thine abode, and do according to all for which the stranger shall cry unto thee,—to the end that all the peoples of the earth may know thy Name､ so as to revere thee like thy people Israel, and know that thy Name hath been given unto this house､ which I have built?
content_old: 33 then wilt thou thyself hear out of the heavens､ out of the settled place of thine abode, and do according to all for which the stranger shall cry unto thee,—to the end that all the peoples of the earth may know thy Name､ so as to revere thee like thy people Israel, and know that thy Name hath been given unto this house､ which I have built?

content: 34 When thy people shall go forth to war against their enemies, whithersoever thou mayest send them,—and shall pray unto thee in the direction of this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy Name
content_old: 34 When thy people shall go forth to war against their enemies, whithersoever thou mayest send them,—and shall pray unto thee in the direction of this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy Name

content: 35 then wilt thou hear､ out of the heavens､ their prayer and their supplication,—and maintain their right.
content_old: 35 then wilt thou hear､ out of the heavens､ their prayer and their supplication,—and maintain their right.

content: 36 When they sin against thee—for there is no son of earth who sinneth not—and thou shalt be angry with them, and deliver them up before an enemy,—who shall carry them away as their captives into a land—far away or near;
content_old: 36 When they sin against thee—for there is no son of earth who sinneth not—and thou shalt be angry with them, and deliver them up before an enemy,—who shall carry them away as their captives into a land—far away or near;

content: 37 and they come back to their right mind, in the land whither they have been taken captive,—and so turn and make supplication unto thee in the land of their captivity､ saying, We have sinned､ we have done perversely､ and been lawless;—
content_old: 37 and they come back to their right mind, in the land whither they have been taken captive,—and so turn and make supplication unto thee in the land of their captivity､ saying, We have sinned､ we have done perversely､ and been lawless;—

content: 38 and so turn unto thee with all their heart､ and with all their soul, in the land of their captivity､ whither they have carried them captive,—and shall pray in the direction of their own land､ which thou gavest unto their fathers, and the city which thou hast chosen､ and unto the house which I have built for thy Name
content_old: 38 and so turn unto thee with all their heart､ and with all their soul, in the land of their captivity､ whither they have carried them captive,—and shall pray in the direction of their own land､ which thou gavest unto their fathers, and the city which thou hast chosen､ and unto the house which I have built for thy Name

content: 39 then wilt thou hear out of the heavens—out of the settled place of thine abode—their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause,—and forgive thy people､ that wherein they sinned against thee?
content_old: 39 then wilt thou hear out of the heavens—out of the settled place of thine abode—their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause,—and forgive thy people､ that wherein they sinned against thee?

content: 40 Now O my God､ let—I beseech thee—thine eyes be open, and thine ears attent,—unto the prayer of this place.
content_old: 40 Now O my God､ let—I beseech thee—thine eyes be open, and thine ears attent,—unto the prayer of this place.

content: 41 Now therefore､ arise! O Yahweh God､ unto thy rest, thou､ and the ark of thy strength: Thy priests O Yahweh God､ let them be clothed with salvation, and thy men of lovingkindness let them rejoice in prosperity.
content_old: 41 Now therefore､ arise! O Yahweh God､ unto thy rest, thou､ and the ark of thy strength: Thy priests O Yahweh God､ let them be clothed with salvation, and thy men of lovingkindness let them rejoice in prosperity.

content: 1 Now when Solomon had made an end of praying Fire came down out of the heavens, and consumed the ascending-offering and the sacrifices,—and the glory of Yahweh filled the house;
content_old: 1 Now when Solomon had made an end of praying Fire came down out of the heavens, and consumed the ascending-offering and the sacrifices,—and the glory of Yahweh filled the house;

content: 2 so that the priests could not enter into the house of Yahweh,—because the glory of Yahweh filled the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 2 so that the priests could not enter into the house of Yahweh,—because the glory of Yahweh filled the house of Yahweh;

content: 3 and all the sons of Israel seeing the descending of the fire and the glory of Yahweh upon the house then knelt they down with their faces toward the ground､ upon the pavement､ and bowed themselves in prostration, and gave thanks unto Yahweh､ For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.
content_old: 3 and all the sons of Israel seeing the descending of the fire and the glory of Yahweh upon the house then knelt they down with their faces toward the ground､ upon the pavement､ and bowed themselves in prostration, and gave thanks unto Yahweh､ For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.

content: 4 And the king and all the people were offering sacrifice before Yahweh.
content_old: 4 And the king and all the people were offering sacrifice before Yahweh.

content: 5 And King Solomon offered a sacrifice—of oxen twenty-two thousand, and of sheep a hundred and twenty thousand,—and so the king and all the people dedicated the house of God;
content_old: 5 And King Solomon offered a sacrifice—of oxen twenty-two thousand, and of sheep a hundred and twenty thousand,—and so the king and all the people dedicated the house of God;

content: 6 while the priests over their charges were standing､ the Levites also with the instruments for the songs of Yahweh､ which David the king had made, for giving thanks unto Yahweh､ For age-abiding is his lovingkindness, when David offered praise by their means,—and the priests kept on blowing trumpets over against them､ while all Israel were standing.
content_old: 6 while the priests over their charges were standing､ the Levites also with the instruments for the songs of Yahweh､ which David the king had made, for giving thanks unto Yahweh､ For age-abiding is his lovingkindness, when David offered praise by their means,—and the priests kept on blowing trumpets over against them､ while all Israel were standing.

content: 7 And Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of Yahweh, for he offered there the ascending-sacrifices､ and the fat portions of the peace-offerings,—because the altar of bronze which Solomon had made was not able to receive the ascending-sacrifice and the meal-offering and the fat portions.
content_old: 7 And Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of Yahweh, for he offered there the ascending-sacrifices､ and the fat portions of the peace-offerings,—because the altar of bronze which Solomon had made was not able to receive the ascending-sacrifice and the meal-offering and the fat portions.

content: 8 And Solomon made a festival—at that time—for seven days､ and all Insrael with him, an exceeding great convocation,—from the entering in of Hamath､ unto the ravine of Egypt.
content_old: 8 And Solomon made a festival—at that time—for seven days､ and all Insrael with him, an exceeding great convocation,—from the entering in of Hamath､ unto the ravine of Egypt.

content: 9 And they made､ on the eighth day､ a closing feast,—because the dedication of the altar they had kept seven days and a festival seven days.
content_old: 9 And they made､ on the eighth day､ a closing feast,—because the dedication of the altar they had kept seven days and a festival seven days.

content: 10 And on the twenty-third of the seventh month he sent the people away to their own homes,—rejoicing and glad in heart, over the goodness which Yahweh had performed unto David and unto Solomon､ and unto Israel his people.
content_old: 10 And on the twenty-third of the seventh month he sent the people away to their own homes,—rejoicing and glad in heart, over the goodness which Yahweh had performed unto David and unto Solomon､ and unto Israel his people.

content: 11 Thus Solomon finished the house of Yahweh､ and the house of the king,—and all that had come in upon the heart of Solomon､ to do in the house of Yahweh and in his own house he prosperously executed.
content_old: 11 Thus Solomon finished the house of Yahweh､ and the house of the king,—and all that had come in upon the heart of Solomon､ to do in the house of Yahweh and in his own house he prosperously executed.

content: 12 Then appeared Yahweh unto Solomon by night,—and said to him､ I have heard thy prayer, and have made choice of this place for myself､ as a house of sacrifice:—
content_old: 12 Then appeared Yahweh unto Solomon by night,—and said to him､ I have heard thy prayer, and have made choice of this place for myself､ as a house of sacrifice:—

content: 13 If I shut up the heavens that there be no rain, or if I lay command on the locust､ to devour the land,— or if I send pestilence､ amongst my people:
content_old: 13 If I shut up the heavens that there be no rain, or if I lay command on the locust､ to devour the land,— or if I send pestilence､ amongst my people:

content: 14 if my people upon whom my Name is called shall humble themselves､ and pray and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways then will I myself hear out of the heavens, and forgive their sin､ and heal their land.
content_old: 14 if my people upon whom my Name is called shall humble themselves､ and pray and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways then will I myself hear out of the heavens, and forgive their sin､ and heal their land.

content: 15 Now mine eyes shall be open, and mine ears attent,—to the prayer of this place.
content_old: 15 Now mine eyes shall be open, and mine ears attent,—to the prayer of this place.

content: 16 Now therefore､ have I chosen and hallowed this house, that my Name may be there､ unto times age-abiding,—and mine eyes and my heart shall be there､ all the days.
content_old: 16 Now therefore､ have I chosen and hallowed this house, that my Name may be there､ unto times age-abiding,—and mine eyes and my heart shall be there､ all the days.

content: 17 Thou therefore if thou wilt walk before me､ as David thy father walked, even to do according to all that I have commanded thee,—and my statutes and regulations thou wilt observe
content_old: 17 Thou therefore if thou wilt walk before me､ as David thy father walked, even to do according to all that I have commanded thee,—and my statutes and regulations thou wilt observe

content: 18 then will I establish the throne of thy kingdom,—according as I covenanted to David thy father､ saying—There shall not fail thee a man, to rule over Israel.
content_old: 18 then will I establish the throne of thy kingdom,—according as I covenanted to David thy father､ saying—There shall not fail thee a man, to rule over Israel.

content: 19 But if ye yourselves shall turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments､ which I have set before you,—and shall go and serve other gods, and bow down to them
content_old: 19 But if ye yourselves shall turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments､ which I have set before you,—and shall go and serve other gods, and bow down to them

content_old: 20 then will I root you out from off the soil､ which I have given to you, and this house､ which I have hallowed for my Name will I cast off from before my face,—and will appoint it for a by-word and a mockery､ among all the peoples;

content: 21 and this house which hath been renowned all that pass by near it shall be astonished,—and say､ Wherefore hath Yahweh done thus and thus to this land､ and to this house?

content_old: 3 And Solomon went to Hamath-zobah,—and prevailed against it;

content_old: 5 and he built Beth-horon､ the upper, and Beth-horon､ the nether,—fortified cities, with walls､ and doors and bars;

content_old: 6 and Baalath､ and all the store cities which pertained to Solomon, and all the chariot cities､ and the cities of the horsemen,—and every delight of Solomon which he delighted to build in Jerusalem､ and in the Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.

content: 7 As for all the people that were left､ of the Hittites and the Amorites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, who were not of Israel;—

content_old: 8 of their sons who were left after them in the land, whom the sons of Israel had not utterly destroyed Solomon enrolled them as tributary—unto this day.

content_old: 9 But of the sons of Israel were there none whom he delivered up as bondmen unto his work,—for they were men of war､ and his captains and his heroes, and captains over his chariots､ and his horsemen.

content_old: 10 These moreover､ were the chiefs of his officers whom King Solomon had､ two hundred and fifty,—who wielded dominion over the people.

content_old: 11 And the daughter of Pharaoh Solomon brought up､ out of the city of David, unto the house which he had built for her,—for he said､ A wife of mine must not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, for holy are those places wherein to the ark of Yahweh hath come.

content: 12 Then Solomon offered up ascending-sacrifices､ unto Yahweh,—upon the altar of Yahweh, which he had built before the porch:
content_old: 12 Then Solomon offered up ascending-sacrifices､ unto Yahweh,—upon the altar of Yahweh, which he had built before the porch:

content_old: 13 even according to the duty of each a day upon its own day, offering up according to the commandment of Moses､ for the sabbaths､ and for the new moons, and for the appointed feasts､ three times in the year,—in the festival of unleavened cakes and in the festival of weeks､ and in the festival of booths;

content_old: 14 and he caused to stand､ according to the regulation of David his father､ the courses of the priests over their service and of the Levites over their charges､ to offer praise and to minister before the priests､ for the duty of each day upon its own day, and the gate-keepers in their courses､ at every several gate,—for such was the commandment of David the man of God;

content_old: 15 neither departed they from the commandment of the king､ concerning the priests and the Levites as to any duty､ or as to the treasuries.

content: 16 So all the work of Solomon was prepared, from the day of founding the house of Yahweh､ even as far as the finishing thereof,—complete was the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 16 So all the work of Solomon was prepared, from the day of founding the house of Yahweh､ even as far as the finishing thereof,—complete was the house of Yahweh.
